messageBody:
> I am a JUNit newbie - does anyone perhaps know if what the
> de-facto standard approach is to data-driven JUnit testing
> (if something like that exists).
>
> Is it even relevant as far as unit testing is concerned?

It is totally relevant. A few weeks (maybe months) after you start
using JUnit seriously, you'll realize you need to use data driven test
design to eliminate duplication of test code. When we got to that
point, we wrote some handy-dandy Java utility code to make it easy to
extract rows of data from an Excel spreadsheet. Then we can cycle
through a single JUnit test 300 times with different data. We've found
it's often easier to understand the test data if it's in a tabular
format (a spreadsheet) than if it's written directly into the Java code.


Todd.
